intro: Ligusticum apiodorum, commonly known as the Japanese honewort, is a perennial herb native to East Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. Ligusticum apiodorum is often cultivated for its aromatic foliage and ornamental value. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and prefers partial to full shade.
